## Public Member Functions

### internalKnownBits() {#a5f264104cc3a87ed07dd196d281ccd2c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="unsigned llvm::BasicBlockInfo::internalKnownBits () const"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Compute the number of known offset bits internally to this block.

This number should be used to predict worst case padding when splitting the block.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armbasicblockinfo-h/#l00078">78</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armbasicblockinfo-h">ARMBasicBlockInfo.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### postKnownBits() {#a9fcaddb16aceac174b38bb7bc118bdfe}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned llvm::BasicBlockInfo::postKnownBits (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> Align=<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">llvm::Align</a>(1)) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Compute the number of known low bits of postOffset.

If this block contains inline asm, the number of known bits drops to the instruction alignment. An aligned terminator may increase the number of know bits. If LogAlign is given, also consider the alignment of the next block.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armbasicblockinfo-h/#l00104">104</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armbasicblockinfo-h">ARMBasicBlockInfo.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### postOffset() {#a96d35759d0115509c273fbdfd8fe011a}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>unsigned llvm::BasicBlockInfo::postOffset (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> Alignment=<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a>(1)) const</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Compute the offset immediately following this block.

If <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/align">Align</a> is specified, return the offset the successor block will get if it has this alignment.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armbasicblockinfo-h/#l00090">90</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armbasicblockinfo-h">ARMBasicBlockInfo.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

## Public Member Attributes

### KnownBits {#a57a9e20cafe54e922aeead667cdd73ff}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint8&#95;t llvm::BasicBlockInfo::KnownBits = 0</>}>
<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/knownbits">KnownBits</a> - The number of low bits in Offset that are known to be exact.

The remaining bits of Offset are an upper bound.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armbasicblockinfo-h/#l00062">62</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armbasicblockinfo-h">ARMBasicBlockInfo.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### Offset {#acadf079e9232969cd61ca5744b10dd16}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="unsigned llvm::BasicBlockInfo::Offset = 0">
Offset - Distance from the beginning of the function to the beginning of this basic block.

Offsets are computed assuming worst case padding before an aligned block. This means that subtracting basic block offsets always gives a conservative estimate of the real distance which may be smaller.

Because worst case padding is used, the computed offset of an aligned block may not actually be aligned.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armbasicblockinfo-h/#l00051">51</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armbasicblockinfo-h">ARMBasicBlockInfo.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### PostAlign {#a3322f1dcf981856028e4ec195de0024d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="Align llvm::BasicBlockInfo::PostAlign">
PostAlign - When &gt; 1, the block terminator contains a .align directive, so the end of the block is aligned to PostAlign bytes.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armbasicblockinfo-h/#l00071">71</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armbasicblockinfo-h">ARMBasicBlockInfo.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### Size {#a1b26f2a8fbde15592af8af3fb950d8fc}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="unsigned llvm::BasicBlockInfo::Size = 0">
Size - Size of the basic block in bytes.

If the block contains inline assembly, this is a worst case estimate.

The size does not include any alignment padding whether from the beginning of the block, or from an aligned jump table at the end.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armbasicblockinfo-h/#l00058">58</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armbasicblockinfo-h">ARMBasicBlockInfo.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### Unalign {#aadef2620c9e7d116fda27a2d9edbd125}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>uint8&#95;t llvm::BasicBlockInfo::Unalign = 0</>}>
Unalign - When non-zero, the block contains instructions (inline asm) of unknown size.

The real size may be smaller than Size bytes by a multiple of 1 &lt;&lt; Unalign.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armbasicblockinfo-h/#l00067">67</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armbasicblockinfo-h">ARMBasicBlockInfo.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
